website_summaries.verdict: Sharp-looking touch mouse that works as good as it looks and can flatten for storage.
pros: Extremely portable design as it folds down flat for transport or storage and curves upward for use
Stylish mouse that you'll love to use
Will operate successfully on any sort of surface
Scrolls in any direction with a simple touch movement
Works over a distance up to 30', so you'll have plenty of flexibility for using it
cons: Takes some practice time to use it efficiently

customer_reviews.title: Replacing an old one, still a great mouse.
customer_reviews.text: Got this to replace one that’s 4-5 yrs old. Still worked fine but I lost the little USB transmitter unit and you can’t get a replacement for that. New one arrived within 48 hrs, included good set of name brand batteries. The click on snap is a bit sticky but I assume this will smooth out with some use. Action seems faster and more precise with the new one. Expensive mouse but it’s not some piece of junk knock-off. I’ve had no problem moving back and forth between the arc mouse and regular mouses (mice?) but I’ve had one for years.
customer_reviews.author: gjrnd1

customer_reviews.title: I just couldn't get used to it.
customer_reviews.text: I knew it might be awkward at first and tried to give it time to adjust. But I just could not get used to the vast differences between this and a mouse. I ended up returning this which is too bad because I like the idea of how it works. I think one of the biggest things that I disliked was the lack of a real middle scroll button. Again that's mostly on me.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Nelson

customer_reviews.title: Made for larger hands
customer_reviews.text: So I purchased this to replace my previous generation arc mouse and have to say that I was rather disappointed. My old arc mouse was slightly smaller which made it fit my hand better, this arc mouse is a bit bigger and with my palm resting on the end, the buttons were not reachable because the active part of right and left click buttons is towards the tip. This resulted in having to reposition my hand to work the mouse. My old arc mouse was also half the price of this Microsoft version. + Elegant design + Touch scroll wheel + Flat position for suitcase storage - Buttons too close to end of mouse - Price
customer_reviews.author: Lance

customer_reviews.title: One of my favorite, most convenient pieces of tech.
customer_reviews.text: Travel a lot for work and traditional mice are always difficult to carry with me without a backpack due to size. When in the inactive mode, this mouse fits in my pocket like a cellphone. It's super easy to pull out and use, never have connection issues, battery life is fantastic. Only complaint is that occasionally the scroll wheel feature will lock up and quit working; have to turn the mouse on-then-off again to get it to work.
customer_reviews.author: Walker C. Evans

customer_reviews.title: Liked it so much, I bought another after nine years
customer_reviews.text: This is my second one of these. I bought the first in 2011, and it still works and is barely the worse for wear (every so often one of the buttons needs an extra click ... after NINE years). The batteries last for months. The touch scroll wheel is precise, and the design is extremely elegant and ergonomic. Totally worth the money!
customer_reviews.author: Rebtile

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product, but somewhat pricey
customer_reviews.text: What a cool mouse! It folds up nicely to fit in your briefcase or backpack. The USB dongle attaches via magnet and it turns on when you bend it. It is pricey, so I'm not sure it's worth that much - hence the 4 stars. But I really love this mouse (even though I'm an Apple zealot sworn to hate Microsoft). Shhhhhh don't tell my friends at Apple...
customer_reviews.author: Greg E.

customer_reviews.title: I've moved on to Bluetooth mice but still go back to this because of its cool factor and overall reliability
customer_reviews.text: Had mine for years and still works well. I've moved on to Bluetooth mice but still go back to this because of its cool factor and overall reliability. Receiver falls off fairly easily from the bottom of the mouse but works quite well. Tracks well and once you get used to it the scroll touch zone is nice as well.
customer_reviews.author: Flying Spur

customer_reviews.title: the best
customer_reviews.text: the best mouse ever. this is the second one for. the first one after a couple of years finally broke so I got another one.
customer_reviews.author: R JACKSON

customer_reviews.title: Would be a good mouse if the scroll function worked properly
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this Microsoft Arc Touch Mouse for about a year and generally like the way it feels and tracks and its portability. BUT... the scroll function pretty much stops functioning about 10 times per hour. I have to straighten it out to turn off, then bend it back into place in order for it re-connect to the laptop and work properly.
customer_reviews.author: R. Adams

customer_reviews.title: Best travel mouse on the market
customer_reviews.text: This is far and away my favorite mouse. Phenomenal product, the responsiveness is unparalleled in devices twice the cost, the haptic feedback when using the scroll wheel is a great touch, and the ability to flatten the mouse out for travel (Which also turns the power off to the device) makes it the perfect travel mouse. Battery life is great, and connectivity is wonderful as well. I cannot say enough good things about this mouse. The price is high compared to a lot of other travel mice but if comfort, reliability, and accuracy matter to you, this is worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Ricciardi

customer_reviews.title: My favorite mouse!
customer_reviews.text: This is my second device. I used the first one for about 5 years and wore it out! Most compact and reliable I have had.
customer_reviews.author: lsnider37

customer_reviews.title: Never want to be without it!
customer_reviews.text: I've bought this model several times over the years to go with all of my systems. I'm VERY pleased with the performance. I WILL caution, accidentally dropping it repeatedly CAN effect function. Other than that, I love the product.
customer_reviews.author: Mark B.

customer_reviews.title: Love this mouse, perfect for travel
customer_reviews.text: Still using this mouse after all these years. I love how I can make it straight to fit into my pocket (as I walk to a conf room meeting from my desk), or want to take home with me and pop into my purse). I get compliments all the time -- mostly from guys actually, haha! It does take a little while to get used to, with the buttons and scrolling. The one thing though is that because it's sensitive, sometimes even when you're not "doing anything", it will scroll on its own (it's done this to me while doing a presentation...now I know to leave it at my desk next time!).
customer_reviews.author: J. M. Gamiao

customer_reviews.title: Loved how it goes flat so I can stick it ...
customer_reviews.text: Still use this today! Loved how it goes flat so I can stick it into my laptop sleeve bag. Also looks pretty cool and I get tons of compliments on it when I use it. Doesn't use much battery and turns off on its own when not in use. The best part is the middle up and down toggle. It is touch sensitive so there no spinning wheel there but theres something in there that give it the wheel clicking feel if that makes any sense. I bought my sister one as well and she loves it. Would buy again!
customer_reviews.author: Yee Banh

customer_reviews.title: Never Turns Off
customer_reviews.text: The mouse is nifty but came broken. I didn't realize when the mouse is in a flat position is supposed to turn off. After reviewing specs sometime later I realize its not normal for the light to stay on during flat position. I have to replace battery every week or take out my battery after every used. Not pleased at all.
customer_reviews.author: Neji Vsnaruto

customer_reviews.title: My fave!
customer_reviews.text: This is my favorite mouse and I have ordered one for each of my laptops. It is comfortable and easy to maneuver. Nicely fits in your palm.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding - esp for travel
customer_reviews.text: I love it. Been using old school mouse pointers for years, and always annoyed at the amount of space they take up when I travel. I've seen these around for some time, but was hesitant because of the price. With several months of use already, I can say I wish I had made the decision much earlier.
customer_reviews.author: Roy Fine

customer_reviews.title: I love them so much i have 4
customer_reviews.text: By far my favorite mouse EVER I have 4 of these guys, one of which is a "surface arc touch mouse" which basically means you don't need the USB dongle for it to communicate with a microsoft surface laptop. I love this thing. It's easy to use, feels great in your hands, durable, good on batteries. Only complaint. kinda pricey. but WELL worth it. Highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: NikkiullisTop Contributor: Woodworking

customer_reviews.title: I like it, but..
customer_reviews.text: I like it so much. This is the second one I bought. However, I bought it because of the first one suddenly stopped connecting with no reason. But I do like the design of it.
customer_reviews.author: Jimmy L

customer_reviews.title: Mouse had a defedct with the scrolling function of center button
customer_reviews.text: I love the Microsoft Arc Touch mouse. This was my second purchase. I would have rated this a 5 star but the mouse seems to have a flaw where the roller function of the center button looses it scrolling capability sporadically and requires turning the mouse off/on to restore the scroll capability. I owned it too long and felt it unfair to return.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Definitely worth the price. Tried the "generic" version, but there it doesn't compare to this product.
customer_reviews.author: J. Lopez

customer_reviews.title: which is kind of annoying. In terms of the design
customer_reviews.text: Mouse can sometimes stop working. I will have to snap the mouse off and on again to get it to work. This occurs about 3-6x a day, which is kind of annoying. In terms of the design, it fits very well in my purse and is sleek/compact.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Responsive, quiet, and travels flat. I'm glad I chose this mouse!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased about 3 months ago after seeing two coworkers enjoy theirs. So far I like everything about it. It's responsive on nearly any surface, clicks quietly enough to use in meetings, and it travels flat. In fact, I bought it specifically for travel, but it's become my "everyday" mouse. I'm glad I chose this one.
customer_reviews.author: MK Martin

customer_reviews.title: Love this thing
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable to use, easy to store in my computer bag. The average mouse takes up too much room and is too bulky to put in the small bag I keep my Surface Pro3.
customer_reviews.author: Hoyt D Tanner

customer_reviews.title: Nice looks, functions, but a pain to use
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this mouse because I wanted a nearly full size mouse, but needed something that I could easily stash in my laptop bag. Considering the Arc Touch Mouse folds flat for storage, it definitely met my expectation in terms of "stashability". Another definite plus is the fact that flattening the mouse also turns it off; no more forgetting to switch off your wireless mouse. Even though this mouse looks really nice and has some great features, it is literally a pain to use. If I handle it more than an hour or so, my wrist and hand start hurting. Hopefully, Microsoft will redesign this thing with ergonomics in mind.
customer_reviews.author: David Burnette

customer_reviews.title: Great for everything except Photoshop
customer_reviews.text: I really like this mouse. I've been using it for a few years now and the only flaw I've found is that when using Photoshop you can't get a precise "click" when scrolling to select a brush size. Other than that it is an excellent product and I use it everyday. One little thing they did that to me was going above and beyond was once the mouse is set up it has you do a little interactive exercise to learn how to use your new mouse. Very cool in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: thatoneguy

customer_reviews.title: Clever design, poor performance
customer_reviews.text: The design on this mouse is very clever, but it just doesn't work as well as other mice. It has a click scroll feedback where the mouse clicks at you when you use the scroll "wheel". Unfortunately, the controls for this are hardware based, not software based, so even when you're not scrolling on screen, the mouse is still clicking in your hand. It's rather annoying and defeats the purpose of feedback. The optical performance was average at best, and I often found myself shaking or lifting the mouse to reset its position. Eventually I bought a different mouse, and gave this one to a coworker, who had the same experience as I did.
customer_reviews.author: Kurt

customer_reviews.title: Best mouse ever!
customer_reviews.text: The mouse arrived two days early! I plugged it into my Acer laptop and it worked immediately. I've been using it a great deal over the last 24 hours and I don't understand the negative comments about the mouse buttons at all, they depress easily and accurately every time. I really like the center haptic touch panel - it scrolls nicely and the page up/down feature is great. The blue laser has tracked quite well on my leopard print bed sheets, the arm of my microfiber recliner and on the kitchen counter. It fits perfectly into the side pocket on my neoprene laptop sleeve and couldn't be more convenient. This thing is great!
customer_reviews.author: CamanoGreg

customer_reviews.title: Very disapointed
customer_reviews.text: I don't often write reviews... really only when absolutely delighted or disappointed. This item is the later. There are two main issues that cannot be ignored. First is that the scrolling function is basically unusable. Second is that the storage location for the receiver is impractical (it is held on the underside by a magnet). Finally it is really not all that comfortable to hold in the hand. Other than this it is very sleek. Version two of this device will have a proper scroll wheel and internal storage of the receiver. Until then, I cannot recommend this product at all.
customer_reviews.author: D. S. Martin

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use, easy to replace batteries. Comfortable to hold, open and close.
customer_reviews.author: E. Gallego

customer_reviews.title: One complaint, overall decent mouse
customer_reviews.text: I need a low profile mouse to fit in my desk drawer, most mice are too tall, so keep in mind I'm using this mouse every day, all day. Happy to say it was plug and play with my Belkin KVM switch. Comfortable in the hand, except for the really stiff clicks it would be rated higher. The stiff click required is causing me to move my hand/wrist in a manner that has increased my carpal tunnel like symptoms since I started using it wrist and forearm pain). So much so that I've purchased another low profile mouse to try out. If I was going to use this only occasionally for travel, I'd give it 4 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Diana

customer_reviews.title: Great portable mouse
customer_reviews.text: These our the most portable mice on the market, though durability sucks. I am currently on my 4th MS Arc mouse.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Viscomi

customer_reviews.title: LOVE this mouse!
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent product! I did experience the issues with buttons and sensativity settings others seemed to have. I manually reconfigured the settings to my specific preferenes using the 'Devices and Printers' feature on my laptop and it was 'smooth clicking and scrolling' from there. The finger scroll took a little getting used to. I have been using the Arc Touch for about 3 month now and once you get used to using it, it becomes difficult to use a 'regular' mouse. I also travel a lot so the ease of portability put this one over the top for me. I have several of my coworkers looking to purchase this item...
customer_reviews.author: KBrown

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this mouse over five years ago and it has worked perfectly under yesterday. I love the feel and the quietness of it. So, when this died and I fished out another of the old-style wireless mouse, I was reminded of how much I like the Arc Touch. Now I'm trying to decide if I want to buy another one--so expensive!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Real Deal
customer_reviews.text: Product arrived on time and packaged exceptionally well. It was in original Microsoft box. This is the real deal. Works great with my Surface Pro. Added bonus has a USB which you can plug into any device and use the mouse.
customer_reviews.author: M. Washington

customer_reviews.title: No scroll wheel! :)
customer_reviews.text: I can’t believe that this is one of the few mice for PC’s without a scroll wheel! It’s sleek, comfortable, and allows for use with ease.
customer_reviews.author: Green Girl

customer_reviews.title: Amazingly Practical
customer_reviews.text: This is the best mouse I've ever had / used. It actually requires LESS space than a mini mouse due to its thinness but it is as functional & comfortable as a full sized mouse. It fits perfectly in a crowded bag. I don't know why anyone would want to carry it in their pockets, but as advertised it fits comfortably in your pants pocket. It is less bulky than the average male wallet. Pros: Comfort & Wow factor from anyone that sees it Cons: The flexible / rubbery part needs regular spot cleaning for best appearance
customer_reviews.author: Tahj

customer_reviews.title: The best travel mouse ever!
customer_reviews.text: I travel a lot for my job, and in the past, I've had small "travel mice", which were essentially regular mice, but smaller. They have been hard to handle and I didn't use them because of how uncomfortable they were. This mouse flattens when not in use, which means it can fit easily in nearly any pocket, and when it opens its full size, so your hand doesn't cramp up. The roller bar also has satisfying feedback when you slide your finger across the silver strip. With heavy use, I've had to replace the 2 AAA batteries once every 3ish months.
customer_reviews.author: MC

customer_reviews.title: Adjusting
customer_reviews.text: I waited a few weeks before writing about the mouse. It has taken some major adjustment, and I'm still not completely comfortable with the scrolling. I've been using a notebook mouse, so the size has also taken some getting used to. That being said, it is growing on me. My favorite function is the on/off. When flattened, it slides into any pocket, and as I have the memory of a sieve, it helps me with battery life; I don't have to worry about whether or not I remembered to turn it off. However, I don't know if I would be as pleased if I had paid the full price.
customer_reviews.author: mica

customer_reviews.title: Nano transceiver is lame....
customer_reviews.text: Just got it and first of all I thought it was bluetooth so I am really bummed about that not being true. How lame is a mobile mouse that uses a transceiver? Seriously they actually think you can let this thing stick out from the side of my laptop and not get lost, oh and that magnet, again seriously, that is supposed to hold it on? I will give it a week and then probably send it back and buy a normal mouse, with bluetooth. Great mouse, works very well, still think the transceiver is stupid and it should have been bluetooth.
customer_reviews.author: BZ

customer_reviews.title: Best. Mouse. Ever.
customer_reviews.text: This has been my favorite mouse ever! It flattens out great to fit in my laptop bag. The USB receiver barely sticks out of my laptop. It's super quiet, and it even has some kind of haptic feedback in the scroll "wheel" (which is actually flat and has no visible moving parts) to let you know you are scrolling. Also, I use my mouse every day and only change the batteries (two AAA) every few weeks.
customer_reviews.author: Shaun Anthony

customer_reviews.title: Best mouse ever?
customer_reviews.text: This is an amazing mouse! I really love showing off the "break it" to turn on feature. It's REALLY accurate, feels good in the hand. My developers REALLY like this along with the surface 4. This is the kind of tech that makes Mac users turn their heads.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Dytmire

customer_reviews.title: Very sleek, very cool!
customer_reviews.text: I must admit that it took some getting use to because the shape is so different than any other mouse you have tried, but after a few tries I grew to love it. The shape reduces the amount of hand motion that basic mouses require. Just remember to flatten it out after every use, or your batteries will drain...yes, you do have to snap it up to turn "on", and push down to flatten to turn "off". I would not recommend for a household with little kids because it is an attention getter, similar to how little kids HAVE to play with your cellphones once their eyes target in on it (parents and grandparents you know what I mean!)
customer_reviews.author: Tulasi

customer_reviews.title: Sorry, wanted to be a fan, but am not!
customer_reviews.text: I've been trying to use it for about two months now and find it terribly frustrating, like it has a mind of it's own! I've swapped out batteries, logged off, back on, taken out the transceiver, etc.. but still not happy with it at all. I've done research to see if it was user error, but that's crazy. I've been using a mouse for a LONG time. Also, if it's not stored in it's own pouch I find the magnetic component to attach the transceiver isn't strong enough so it gets lost in the bottom of my bag.
customer_reviews.author: Colleen edwards

customer_reviews.title: Great Idea!
customer_reviews.text: Pros: -Modern, sleek, edgy design. -Very simple to set up. Cons: -The right and left mouse buttons seem too low compared to a regular-shaped mouse. This is taking some getting used to and even drove me to switch it again for my old mouse. -Definitely not a Gaming Mouse. Don't even try. Bottom Line: I had high hopes for this mouse, but though I love the design and light weight, I am still trying to get my hand used to the low buttons. Don't really regret buying it and am seriously giving it a shot.
customer_reviews.author: TheDiegoAguirre

customer_reviews.title: Portability is the main point
customer_reviews.text: I probably wouldn't buy this for full price as it's largely a novelty, but if you see this mouse for $35 or less, it's a decent deal for what it provides. I use this as my portable mouse, keeping it in my laptop case for when I'm mobile. It's a pretty standard mouse, with the main appeal being that it bends flat. I did not like the little vibrating-touch-wheel feel, but if you go into the mouse settings on your computer, you can disable it. I don't know why they would even have that feature to begin with, but I suppose it's possible some people like the fee?
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: blue tooth mouse
customer_reviews.text: Very efficient design. There's a little bit of a learning curve but I think this is going to be better than my old MS infared wireless, which I plopped into the garbage can after a solid 5 year run. It is designed so that you have to manually turn off the mouse after you leave work or turn off the computer. I think the idea is to encourage you to save battery life, as well as the electronic components, all of which wear down over time. It's just another thing to get used to, not a bad idea.
customer_reviews.author: Robert W

customer_reviews.title: PERFECTLY AWESOME
customer_reviews.text: I've only had it for a week and I've already dropped it twice, needless to say I'm a little rough on my electronics. The right button popped out a little, but I was able to pop it back into place. Works perfectly. Works on all kinds of surfaces; very comfortable to use. Scroll and center click work GREAT. The magnet that holds the bluetooth dongle to the mouse kinda scares me, but I haven't had any issues yet. I'd like to see it in the $35 range - that is just me, but it is definitely worth $45!
customer_reviews.author: Jason T. Dameron

customer_reviews.title: Recommended for it's design and overall value for (my) money.
customer_reviews.text: Two years later, it died a peaceful death today. While it lasted, it wasn't very awkward to use. It definitely wasn't my primary mouse to go to but I did carry it around tucked in my laptop's sleeve (I hate track pads). I didn't like the fact that it doesn't 'cup' under my palm but I knew that when I saw the design and I soon learned to pick it with my thumb and ring finger. I know how little I used it and the negligible amount of abuse it took; It should have lasted longer.
customer_reviews.author: N. Bhasin

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic little device!!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is a fantastic mouse. Originally bought one for my wife, but after trying it decided to get one for myself too. This is literally a plug and play device so you don't need to upload any software or nothing. The mouse is really light and ultra responsive and the fact it folds flat means its really easy to transport so i use it at home and in e office. Although I really love this I think it may be difficult for anyone with large hands so it may be worth tying to find this in a store to try it out first before buying it.
customer_reviews.author: Joe90

customer_reviews.title: Coolest computer ever
customer_reviews.text: I love the form and function of this mouse. It fits in my shirt pocket when I carry my laptop to meetings. Bend it to turn it on and straighten it to turn it off. I think that this is the best Microsoft product out there. It does have one problem now. The left click button has to be pushed very hard now after years of use. I still recommend this product. I'll buy another when they make a bluetooth version
customer_reviews.author: Cornel

customer_reviews.title: Great Mouse for Mobility issues
customer_reviews.text: My favorite mouse ever. I have a plate in my right hand and this mouse allows me more mobility.
customer_reviews.author: J. Gossett

customer_reviews.title: Great stylish mouse.
customer_reviews.text: I love this mouse. It is stylish and folds flat so it fits nicely in my bag. Everyone whose seen me use it has commented on the design. The only issue is the usb piece sticks out a bit far from my laptop so I don't like to leave it in and I'm afraid if I leave it on the magnetic holder on the bottom of the mouse that it will fall off. But that isn't a huge concern when I put it in my bag. I was a bit concerned about the durability but so far it has been excellent.
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: Really portable Mouse
customer_reviews.text: I have an original Arc Mouse and really liked it. I bought this is a gift and have to say that it is an exceptional piece of hardware. I have tried "portable" mouse devices for some time. A device I can include in my laptop bag but when I use it, the operation is the same as more stationery model. This one meets all expectations and then to snap it to the off position so I can add it to a pouch in my bag is great. My only disappointment was the storage of the USB adapter but after using it a few times it works well.
customer_reviews.author: John J. Kavanagh

customer_reviews.title: Nice but you will need an aggressive click
customer_reviews.text: I like this, and still carry it with me when I travel (as a backup). As noted in previous reviews the buttons take some force to click. That is the only shortcoming I see with it. I like that it gets straightened for travel (turns off the device) and turns on when you bend it for use. The very small remote receiver for the PC stays in place with the magnetic force (I am sure it can fall off if you try) but stays put in most normal situations.
customer_reviews.author: MT - Colorado

customer_reviews.title: MS Arc Mouse ... Works GREAT
customer_reviews.text: I've used a LOT of mice in my time ... but this has to rank tops with all of 'em! Certainly catches a LOT of attention by those around. I use it for my classes (Instructor at American University). It's very smooth and controllable. As opposed to most mice, it DOESN'T reset it's position or wander across the screen when you lift it from a desk. The "scroll wheel" is two metal tabs that give you a tactile feel when running your finger over them (vibrate) and respond VERY well. I'd give it a 4.8 out of 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: dominik_12

customer_reviews.title: Best portable mouse I have used
customer_reviews.text: This very cool mouse has been a great device, as well as a great show off item. It's amazing how thin this mouse is when flat, and how comfortable it is when arched. The magnetic bottom to keep the very small USB receiver is also a great touch. My favorite feature is the tactile feedback while using the scroll wheel. The flat scroll area clicks and 'spins' when you roll your finger across it and feels very natural. A lot of thought went into the engineering of this product, and though pricey, it holds a special place in my computer bag.
customer_reviews.author: Joey Heck

customer_reviews.title: Travels with everywhere.
customer_reviews.text: Use it everyday. Works well when you don't want to use the touch pad.
customer_reviews.author: ASV Company

customer_reviews.title: Sounds like a cricket, but works like a charm
customer_reviews.text: Compact & beautifully designed, I have been using my Arc mouse for about a year. And like it a lot. It has the perfect amount of sensitivity for general use as well as my graphic design work. Additionally, the shape is perfect for my hands (which are larger than the average woman's hand). FYI the arc/size is too large for the kiddos to use. The only two downsides are: (1) instead of a single middle-button click to open a link in a new tab it takes a double-click, eh. (2) the scroll sound, kind of sounds like a cricket, but it's not that loud.
customer_reviews.author: JB

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good, but the auto-shutoff is annoying
customer_reviews.text: The only complaint I have so far about these is that they turn themselves off after so much inactivity. Makes it hard to wake up a computer when the mouse isn't active. Otherwise, happy with these mice. Bought 2 for executives and no complaints yet.
customer_reviews.author: BIll M

customer_reviews.title: Nice Mouse!
customer_reviews.text: I'm not sure how long ago I bought this mouse, but it's still working as well as it did (perfectly) as the day I bought it, so I can't complain!
customer_reviews.author: Doc

customer_reviews.title: Good portable mouse
customer_reviews.text: It took a bit of getting used to the buttons. I had to be mindful how I place my hand or the buttons would not be reachable, they are not long like the original Arc Mouse, you have to reach the bottom portion of the front to be able to activate either button. Once I got used to it - a month of practice - it is OK. I will keep it and use it until it breaks - 3 stars because it is better than a lot of other wireless mice I have had.
customer_reviews.author: Stan

customer_reviews.title: Awesome mouse
customer_reviews.text: Awesome mouse. It connected fast and I love how you flatten it to power it off. Fast delivery too. Highly recommended seller and product.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Graham

customer_reviews.title: Slick!
customer_reviews.text: Just got this mouse a few days ago. It's a lot more comfortable than it looks. On/Off feature via fold and fold with a magnetic holder for the transmitter. Very cool mouse and has a great feel. The button clicks and scroll feedback is awesome.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Very nice... So far so good.
customer_reviews.text: I like this mouse a lot. It is very comfortable, and responsive. I am a moonlighting computer tech, and having a portable usb mouse, that works and feels flawlessly is a must. They even designed the touch scroll to make a little noise to indicate you touched it, but its not obnoxious. I had the original arc mouse, and loved it. There was nothing wrong with it, I just wanted an upgrade. If the other lasted 3+ years, I'm confident in the new one.
customer_reviews.author: Mcomeau

customer_reviews.title: Microsoft Arc Touch Mouse
customer_reviews.text: Love the style and slim design. However, returned it because I found a better price at BB plus I had an additional $5 off coupon.
customer_reviews.author: Hannah Graham

customer_reviews.title: Innovative.  Coolness factor with easy portability,
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love this mouse. Very innovative design - impresses everyone that sees it. The magnetic usb transciever is tiny but I have not lost it yet. It is comfortable in my hand and I like the touch scroll. It might be addicitive to snap the mouse back and forth. Kind of reminds me of those slap bracelets, but much more durable. It has held up so far! Also a breeze to travel with, as it lays flat and minimizes the bulkiness of my laptop accessory case.
customer_reviews.author: katana

customer_reviews.title: Good design, could improve the experience.
customer_reviews.text: Arc touch mouse is pretty good if you have a strong need for portable devices. You can flatten the mouse and simply put it away in any pocket. And it looks pretty cool in front of your friends, personal experience. :) Talking about the user experience, not so much.. If you don't move around, I would suggest other Microsoft mice such as Sculpt series.
customer_reviews.author: tomatocall

customer_reviews.title: pretty awesome mouse
customer_reviews.text: I previously used a wireless mouse with the thumb roller ball. It was my favorite, but the USB receiver wiring frayed apart after years of use. My husband always complained about that mouse so I decided to try something new. While I am not in love with this mouse, I can't really think of a reason why. It works great, and the USB received is smaller than my thumbnail AND attaches to the bottom of the mouse when travelling. It's really convenient.
customer_reviews.author: K. Greenwald

customer_reviews.title: Great design
customer_reviews.text: This mouse feels amazing, and I am glad none of the negative reviews apply to me or they are exaggerated. The design makes it addictive to hold and to use. The only downside for me is that you have to flatten it to turn it off. I imagine I have to do this every day if use it for my desktop or it will drain the battery, but I'm not sure how much. I think it should turn off automatically or use a cord if that's not possible. I still give it 5 stars for unique design and how it feels in my hand.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Arc Touch Mouse
customer_reviews.text: This mouse is a design marvel. It folds flat as advertised. The size is smaller than a standard mouse, and the arc is also lower. Thus you will need to adjust to using this mouse. However, I have now been using this mouse for 2 weeks - and now am very used to it. The soft touch rubberised back is great to hold. The scroll wheel is a flat strip of metal coloured plastic - and is electronic. Has a great tactile vibration with subtle noise when you scroll. The buttons are gloss plastic however, and they get full of grubby thumb prints in no time. Very good mouse - I just hope it lasts with all that folding/unfolding....
customer_reviews.author: Chucky

customer_reviews.title: I love this mouse.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this mouse when my trackpad stopped working (I have a macbook). Everything about it is perfect! In my opinion, anyway. It's compact, the way it turns on is really cool, the way it has a magnetic strip so you never lose the USB connection is really convenient, its thin and fits in any pocket of my backpack easily, and its comfortable to use! Recommended to anyone who wants a sleek, reliable mouse that's different from the rest. :)
customer_reviews.author: Joan

customer_reviews.title: Love this mouse
customer_reviews.text: I couldn't be happier with this mouse. It is lightweight, portable, so user-friendly, and so much fun! I could click it and unclick it all day. The USB that connects it to the computer is so small that it doesn't get in the way of anything. And when the mouse is disconnected from the computer, the USB attaches to the underside of the mouse via a magnetic. So ingenious. I love that video of the guy that designed it! The scrolling technology is really great as well.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love the Idea, hate the lack of ergonomics
customer_reviews.text: Coolest looking mouse I've seen, good attempt at gesture scrolling. Unsure why there is still clicking sounds with the scrolling. I cannot recommend this mouse to anyone unless it is strictly for portability purposes. When using this mouse in any capacity, my wrist is sore afterward. the mouse is way to small for it to be comfortable with the well made (but to small) curve. If it was about an inch or so longer toward the wrist, it might be different.
customer_reviews.author: Neufology

customer_reviews.title: Scolling is not good
customer_reviews.text: When I saw this mouse, I thought that it was time to move on a touch mouse like a smart phone or iPad so I bought this one. Every thing looked good but the problem is that it is not good to scroll. I am using mouse to scroll pages a lot but the feeling of touch is not good. It seems there is a lag or slippery so I do not recommend this to someone who uses a mouse to scroll pages a lot. (now I am using my old wired mouse with a wheel ^^;)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cool product!
customer_reviews.text: This is a very nifty gadget. It installed in Windows 7 Professional without a glitch. Automatically downloaded the software and did it all the installation silently with minimum of questions asked. The design and operation is completely new from a traditional mouse so it will take a while (probably all of two hours) to get used to it. Has this cool vibrating feeling during scrolling. The double taps and double tap plus hold features are also new.
customer_reviews.author: Hugo D.

customer_reviews.title: Good, durable, with a few issues
customer_reviews.text: It's a very good looking mouse, but it's not as comfortable as I thought it would be (probably because my hands are relatively small). And I've had a few temporary issues with it (signal loss mostly -- not related to batteries), however, after 3 years of use, it's still going, so at least it is durable.
customer_reviews.author: E. Marquez

customer_reviews.title: Very compact
customer_reviews.text: I love that it lays flat when off so it slides right into the pocket of my case for my Surface.
customer_reviews.author: Grandma Sue

customer_reviews.title: I enjoy the mouse very much
customer_reviews.text: Overall, I enjoy the mouse very much. It is easy to move the curser around on the computer, whether using a mouse pad or not. However, I'm not sold on the scrolling pad. Sometimes it works fantastic and other times, not so well. But I like he mouse and will continue using it and hopefully I'll be able to work out the kinks.
customer_reviews.author: John T. Krueger

customer_reviews.title: Good Product
customer_reviews.text: Very nice product.Compact and easy to carry around. The flipping on and off the mouse make u scary that it going to snap in ur hands but it is durable and u ll get used to it. Only some minor things im disappointed with are the description says its a touch mouse but only scroll is touch but the left and right clicks are buttons(may be i misunderstood the product description)....and one more thing is that even when u use the scroll for a swipe it a makes noise just like old mouse wheel for too long even though its not actually scrolling.. Other than these small blip its very gud product.
customer_reviews.author: kriss

customer_reviews.title: Won't work
customer_reviews.text: The product arrived two days late. It was scratched and used. The mouse was faulty and would not operate - not even light up!
customer_reviews.author: Gary A. Henecke

customer_reviews.title: I love this mouse
customer_reviews.text: I love this mouse. It is light-weight, easy, and that it folds flat makes it super-portable. The scroll is easier than the typical raised scroller and the arch to this is really comfortable. Sometimes I have to fold it and unfold it again (turn it off then back on) to get it to work, but it could just be my batteries getting low. I would highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Customer Lady

customer_reviews.title: IT IS NOT BLUETOOTH
customer_reviews.text: I was purchasing this to replace the Arc Touch mouse that came with my laptop. This mouse has that stupid thing you have to plug into the USB port of your computer. Don't be fooled by "Blue track." I'll be returning this.
customer_reviews.author: Kgirrl123

customer_reviews.title: Microsoft Arc Touch Mouse
customer_reviews.text: Just an amazing wireless mouse, so portable and very responsive. For the price this is just wonderful being able to make it flat and just put in my book bag pockets without having things look bulgy. I def give this mouse 5 stars and I am pretty sure anyone who buys this product would do the same. I game with this mouse 24/7 and battery last a good amount even after the low battery indicator has come up.
customer_reviews.author: ThAzn1der

customer_reviews.title: Not the best...
customer_reviews.text: I like this mouse but the scrolling part isn't that great. I have bought and used cheaper mouses that I was happier with. when it gives out someday I will seek out a different one.
customer_reviews.author: MLS

customer_reviews.title: Looks good, works good
customer_reviews.text: My wife did not like most of the computer mice that she tried, she likes the feel of this "Microsoft Arc Touch Mouse" and can make it flat to easily put in a bag or purse. When flat it turns off so the battery does not drain. It also stays in the position show in the picture (I was worried that it would keep trying to lay flat and become frustrating).
customer_reviews.author: Gamer

customer_reviews.title: Cool little mouse!
customer_reviews.text: I like this mouse overall, but have a few suggestions-objections. First of all, it really needs a back button-I miss it terribly. It's also a little large for my female hand- hard to reach al the way down to the top of the buttons to make them click. The scroll button is a little unresponsive at times also. Other than these things, it's a way cool mouse and concept! It's possible that I just haven't used it long enough.
customer_reviews.author: Bbreezy2

customer_reviews.title: Excellent portable mouse.
customer_reviews.text: Been using this mouse for two years daily in the office. Works great. No problems. Just make sure to have extra batteries available. Battery life is pretty good. Wear and tear wise the mouse has held up really well. It's nice to be able to click to flatten and put in your pocket. It get's the job done. Only gripe is I wish I could turn the wheel click off.
customer_reviews.author: Just a Guy

customer_reviews.title: I FEEL PROUD OF OWNING THIS MOUSE
customer_reviews.text: I couldn't be happier. Everybody asks me where to get one because first of all its super cool because of its looks. Then, besides this fact, it is reliable, easy to carry around, since its completely flat when u turn it off. I have own it for about 5 months, and have zero complains. LOVE IT ! and recommend it, especially if u hate to use the pad that comes with laptops.
customer_reviews.author: Gabriela  Pienknagura

customer_reviews.title: Great portability.
customer_reviews.text: Was quick and easy to install on laptop. Like that bit will lay flat so fits in laptop case pocket nicely.
customer_reviews.author: Yvonne

customer_reviews.title: Not a good buy
customer_reviews.text: The Arc Touch Mouse is great as long as you use it at a desk, but anywhere else and the pointer jumps all over the screen. They said that it works on pretty much anything except glass, but it didn't work on my couches (white and black fabric). My carpet. My table. My jeans. So, after trying it out for three weeks I decided to send it back and get another kind of mouse. Hopefully other people will have better luck with it then I did.
customer_reviews.author: Verscienta

customer_reviews.title: Nice and Slim
customer_reviews.text: I really like this mouse; bought to compliment a new 11in Windows computer. Nice and compact fits nicely and takes up no space in my case; no problems with use, I have not experianced any issues with scrolling as mentioned in a review I read. Only downside is it does not work with Macs; it is soley limited to windows, and my primary computer is a MacPro. Other than that I think it is a great mouse.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for travelers
customer_reviews.text: I recently started traveling for work (Again) and this mouse is slim for when I travel, and highly functional for when I am at the clients location. What a GREAT product. There is nothing I don't like about it. It works just like my mouse at home, without a back button... Wahhh... ;-) I would HIGHLY recommend this mouse if you travel a lot, and don't want the bulk of a regular or even a "Laptop" mouse.
customer_reviews.author: T

customer_reviews.title: I've had this mouse for years (I ordered this one ...
customer_reviews.text: I've had this mouse for years (I ordered this one for my husband). We both use them. I've had the same mouse for several years and never had any issues. Always keep a few AAA batteries around though because once that little light starts flashing red you've only got a day or so before you're dead in the water :)
customer_reviews.author: Scott Nicholson

customer_reviews.title: and it's comfortable. Truthfully
customer_reviews.text: It's well-designed, it's portable, and it's comfortable. Truthfully, this was the product that turned my attention to the Surface Pro line of Microsoft computers because I realized that, suddenly, Microsoft has become capable of making quality products with an eye for design. I have owned this for several months without having to replace the battery.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: This is an amazing invention. I work at restaurants and a whole bunch of places where I have to carry a laptop around and instead of this bulky round mouse this on lays flat and works PERFECTLY. I have had it for almost 2 years now and it works the same as the day I bought it. I would buy this product again in a heart beat.
customer_reviews.author: Ken

customer_reviews.title: Received open box with broken mouse
customer_reviews.text: Received what appears to be a previously opened and used mouse. Sharp wires sticking out of the back. USB was missing. Had grease marks and smudges on it. Appalled that this happened.
customer_reviews.author: zanodad

customer_reviews.title: No Great Shakes
customer_reviews.text: Turns out it's just another mouse with a fancy way to turn it off. The worst thing about it for me was this little metal strip that replaces the scroll wheel. Bad idea. It's never there when you need it. A lot of mouse work is second nature, and this little strip is hard to find without glancing down, to find it. It will definitely slow you down. I'd pass.
customer_reviews.author: Mrmxwll

customer_reviews.title: Best mouse
customer_reviews.text: Love this mouse. It's light, small, super comfortable in hand and it purrs like a cat when you scroll! The only problem is I keep leaving it everywhere and some sort of a tracking system would be helpful. But other then that it's perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Y. B.

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME
customer_reviews.text: The title says it all. I was skeptical about buying it at first because I like to make things last, so my old microsoft mouse that used AA batteries and a huge USB receiver needed wasnt so stylish anymore. I bought this because it looked cool and sure enough, it is! I constantly find myself closing it and opening it because it still amazes me how it all works. At first it was uncomfortable, since I was using my old mouse for a few years, but now it is easy to use. The scrolling is easy and unique. I highly recommend if you want people to ask you "What kind of mouse is that!?!?"
customer_reviews.author: kchudoba23

product_meta.title: Microsoft Arc Touch Mouse (Black)
product_meta.description:
FROM THE MANUFACTURER


MICROSOFT ARC TOUCH MOUSE
A revolution in mouse design -The perfect companion for your mobile PC. PERFECTLY PORTABLE-AND AWARD-WINNING-TOUCH TECHNOLOGY
Stylish and eye-grabbing, Arc Touch Mouse is more than a pretty device. It's reliable wireless freedom plus Microsoft touch technology, on the go. Use it just about anywhere, even on a rough wood surface or carpet, thanks to BlueTrack Technology. Plus you can retain wireless control of your computer up to 30 feet away. 

CURVE IT FOR USE, FLATTEN FOR STORAGE
Arc Touch Mouse's innovative design allows for quick use and storage. Curve it comfortably to get started. Then smoothly glide your finger up or down the touch strip. When you're done, keep the tiny transceiver plugged into your computer's USB port, or attach it magnetically onto the underside of the mouse. Then flatten Arc Touch Mouse to turn it off, and slip it into your pocket or bag as easily as a cell phone.

PRECISE VERTICAL SCROLLING BY FEEL, NOT WHEEL
The Touch strip on the Arc Touch Mouse responds precisely to the speed of your finger movement, using Haptic feedback (light vibration that signals scrolling speed) to scan through documents or web pages as quickly-or as cautiously-as needed, entirely by feel.

KEY FEATURES
 1. Flexible Design - Curve for comfort, flatten to pack. A perfect fit for your hand and your mobile lifestyle.
    
    
 2. Power On and Off - Curve to turn on. Flatten to turn off. No button to switch. A green light flashes to show the battery is working, and then turns off to save battery life.
    
    
 3. Touch to Scroll - Click. Tap. Flick. Control. Quickly brush up or down with your finger to flick into hyperfast vertical scrolling for smooth, intuitive navigation. Scroll slowly with a gentle swipe or quickly with a flick of the finger, then tap to stop.
    
    
 4. BlueTrack Technology - Take advantage of BlueTrack Technology, which combines the power of optical with the precision of laser for remarkable tracking on virtually any surface.
    
    
 5. Plug-and-go Nano Transceiver - Leave the Nano Transceiver (USB) plugged in when you're on the go, or stow it magnetically in the mouse.
    
    


PRODUCT DETAILS
 * Flatten for ultimate portability, curve to use
 * 2-way touch scrolling for smooth, intuitive navigation
 * Works on virtually any surface with BlueTrack Technology
 *  Touch scroll tactile feedback
 * Mini transceiver (USB)
 * Design is suitable for use with either hand
